neighbors.name: Daniel A. Smith & Katiann Smith
neighbors.claims: According to Mayes County assessor records, Daniel A. Smith and Katiann Smith jointly own a parcel of land in the county (PIN 490014865) [DataCrosspoint – Mayes Assessor](https://www.datacrosspoint.com/mayes-county-property-search/). A Daniel Smith serves as the Pastor of Parkview Missionary Baptist Church in Chouteau, officiating local services as recently as 2021 [Obituary for Nancy Hall](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/tahlequah-ok/nancy-hall-10245538) [Obituary for Allen Craig](https://www.shipmansfuneralhome.com/obituaries/allen-craig). A Daniel Smith is also listed as the Technology Director for Chouteau-Mazie Public Schools [USAC Form 470](https://publicdata.usac.org/EPC/Prd/Form470/260015041/140131/20944309-USAC_FCC_FORM_470_APPLICATION_260015041_CERTIFIED.pdf). Daniel Smith of Chouteau is the son of the late Jerry Ronald Smith, a long-time missionary helper, and the grandson of James Crow, a local builder who developed the Chouteau Hills area [Obituary for Jerry Smith](https://www.shipmansfuneralhome.com/obituaries/jerry-smith) [Obituary for James Crow](https://www.stephens-key.com/obituaries/JAMES-CROW?obId=1516). No evidence was found of the Smiths taking a public stance on renewable energy development.
neighbors.influence_justification: Likely local pastor and school district employee

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with respect for his likely role as a community faith leader. Acknowledge his family's long-standing history in local development (Crow construction legacy) and emphasize how the project aligns with community values and long-term stewardship.
